item.title: High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’

Publication Date: Monday

Source: [Your News Source]

On Monday morning, K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samiti, found himself in a standoff with the Telangana Anti Corruption Bureau. He refused to enter the ACB office without his lawyer present, leading to significant drama outside the agency’s premises.

  • KTR stated that the ACB barred his lawyer from attending while his statement was recorded.
  • After 45 minutes in their vehicle, KTR left without giving his statement, having submitted a lawyer's response to the ACB notice.
  • He asserted his right to have legal representation during questioning, citing concerns over trust towards the ACB and past incidents involving other politicians.
  • The ACB had summoned him regarding the Formula E race case, linked to an alleged financial transfer to a foreign company.
  • KTR has challenged the ACB's FIR against him in the High Court, which has yet to issue a ruling.
“I do not trust this government and the police are acting under the instructions of a third-rate criminal like Revanth Reddy,” KTR claimed.

The situation has raised questions about legal rights and procedural integrity as KTR awaits further developments in his case.

item.title: 'Emergency' trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut makes a hard-hitting impact as Indira Gandhi as the film promises t - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Emergency' Trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut's Hard-Hitting Portrayal of Indira Gandhi

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

This long-awaited film, set to release on January 17, 2025, marks the 50th anniversary of India's emergency declaration in 1975. The trailer showcases Kangana's transformation into Indira Gandhi, highlighting the gripping narrative the film promises to deliver.

  • The release was delayed due to censor board issues but has now received a U/A certification with suggested cuts.
  • The trailer depicts how Gandhi declared an 'Emergency' in India, emphasizing her powerful dialogue.
  • Kangana expressed gratitude for finally bringing this significant story to the big screen, especially as it resonates with current themes.
  • The film features Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, and Milind Soman among others.
Kangana Ranaut: "This story isn't just about a controversial leader; it delves into themes that remain profoundly relevant today."

Overall, 'Emergency' aims to not only tell a historical tale but also provoke reflection on constitutional resilience.

item.title: HMPV: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital suspected to have tested positive - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Infant in Bengaluru Suspected to Test Positive for HMPV

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: HT News

An eight-month-old infant in Bengaluru is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV). The family reported no recent travel history and showed no symptoms of concern.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2.
  • Health department officials have acknowledged the lab findings but have not independently verified them.
  • HMPV primarily affects children and is associated with about 0.7% of flu cases globally.
  • There are ongoing concerns about HMPV in relation to outbreaks in China.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” a health department official stated.

While there is speculation about the virus, health authorities report no immediate cause for alarm.

item.title: 8-month-old at Bengaluru hospital is first suspected HMPV case in India - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Hospital Reports First Suspected Case of HMPV in India

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

An eight-month-old infant is suspected to have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) at a hospital in Bengaluru. The infant's family has no recent travel history and shows no concerning symptoms.

  • The infant's sample was collected on January 2, 2025.
  • The state health department has not verified the results but trusts the private facility's testing accuracy.
  • HMPV is known to primarily affect children and is present in approximately 0.7% of global flu cases.
  • Health officials in Karnataka have stated they lack detailed information on the specific strain.
  • There are current concerns regarding HMPV's spread in China, but health authorities claim there is nothing to alarm about.
“We trust the accuracy of their testing procedures,” - health department official.

This case marks a significant development in public health as the first suspected instance of HMPV in India, highlighting the need for awareness and monitoring of respiratory infections, especially with ongoing concerns about viral outbreaks globally.

item.title: Tamil Nadu Governor walks out of Assembly without reading address - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi walks out of Assembly without reading customary address

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi departed the State Assembly session on January 6, 2025, without delivering his customary address after expressing his dissatisfaction over the national anthem not being played following the State anthem.

  • The Governor insisted on the national anthem being played but it was not.
  • The Raj Bhavan stated that the incident was an insult to the Constitution and the National Anthem.
  • Mr. Ravi was present for only about three minutes before leaving the House.
  • After his departure, AIADMK members held protests regarding a sexual assault case at Anna University.
  • This is not the first time the Governor has walked out of the Assembly; similar incidents occurred in February 2024 and January 2023.
“Not to be a party to such brazen disrespect to the Constitution and the National Anthem, Governor in deep anguish left the House.”

The incident raises serious questions about the respect for constitutional duties within the Assembly, echoing previous instances of conflict between the Governor and the government.

item.title: Main accused in journalist’s murder in Chhattisgarh arrested from Hyderabad - The Indian Express
item.description:
Main accused in Chhattisgarh journalist Mukesh Chandrakar’s murder arrested in Hyderabad

Date: Sunday, Publication Source: The Indian Express

The Chhattisgarh police have arrested Suresh Chandrakar, the alleged main accused in the murder of journalist Mukesh Chandrakar, from Telangana. The arrest comes after a series of detentions related to the case.

  • Suresh was arrested late at night on Sunday.
  • Three others, including Suresh's brothers, were previously arrested in connection to the murder.
  • Mukesh was reportedly murdered due to interference in his cousin's construction work.
  • Authorities demolished illegal property belonging to Suresh following the murder.
  • Mukesh's body was found in a septic tank a day after he was reported missing.
  • Mukesh was a freelancer with connections to prominent media outlets.
“As a journalist, my colleague paid the ultimate price for exposing the truth...” - Anurag Dwary, Resident Editor, NDTV

This incident highlights the dangers journalists face while pursuing accountability in their work. The ongoing investigation aims to ensure justice for Mukesh Chandrakar.

item.title: ITC shares now trade ex-hotels; Check stock price post demerger - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ITC Shares Trade Ex-Hotels Post-Demerger, Stock Price Set at ₹455.60

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

After a special trading session on January 6, ITC Ltd.'s market price is set at ₹455.60, following the spin-off of its hotels business.

  • The stock opened ₹26 lower following the demerger announcement.
  • Existing shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares held.
  • ITC retains a 40% stake in the newly formed hotel entity.
  • ITC Hotels expected to list by mid-February 2025.
  • The expected market cap for ITC Hotels when listed ranges between ₹100-125 per share.
  • ITC Hotels plans to expand its portfolio from 140 to over 200 hotels by 2030.
“The demerger is expected to unlock substantial shareholder value.” - Prashanth Tapse, Mehta Equities

In conclusion, analysts remain optimistic about the potential growth and profitability of ITC Hotels, suggesting that the demerger could enhance shareholder value significantly.

item.title: Golden Globes 2025 live updates: No wins for India as All We Imagine As Light gets snubbed in both categories - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Golden Globes 2025 live updates: No wins for India as All We Imagine As Light gets snubbed in both categories

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The 2025 Golden Globes saw significant recognition for various films, but India's entry, All We Imagine As Light, left the ceremony without any wins after being nominated in two categories.

  • Leading the nominations was Emilia Pérez with 10 nominations.
  • The ceremony took place on January 5, airing live and attracting significant viewership.
  • Despite nominations, India did not secure any awards.
“India didn’t win any awards despite being nominated in two categories.”

The Golden Globes continue to adapt after previous controversies, aiming for a more engaging and entertaining show.

item.title: From Early Morning Routine To Dinner, This Full-Day Meal Plan Will Keep You Healthy In Winter - NDTV Food
item.description:
Full-Day Meal Plan for Healthy Winter Eating

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Food

Winter poses health challenges such as dry skin and reduced immunity. Dietitian Manpreet Kalra shares a balanced meal plan focused on seasonal foods to maintain warmth and vitality during this season.

Here's Ideal Full-Day Meal Plan For Winter, Suggested By Expert:

  1. Morning: Start with a cup of coriander seeds water for detoxification and improved digestion.
  2. Breakfast: Enjoy vegetable poha for energy and nourishment.
  3. Mid-Morning Snack: Drink black carrot kanji for gut health.
  4. Lunch: Have methi & bajra stuffed rotis with mint-coriander chutney for a wholesome meal.
  5. Post-Lunch: Sip fennel-ajwain water to aid digestion.
  6. Evening Snack: Green tea with roasted makhana for antioxidants and protein.
  7. Dinner: Conclude with broccoli & carrot soup for a light, nutritious end to the day.

Best Winter Picks for Specific Health Needs:

  • Thyroid Health: Kalonji and coriander seeds tea.
  • Diabetes: Methi and bajra-stuffed roti.
  • Gut Health: Black carrot kanji.
  • Skin Health: Red carrot salad.
  • Immunity: Fresh ginger and turmeric tea.
  • Hair Health: Aliv seeds ladoo.

Dietitian Manpreet Kalra’s meal plan advocates a healthy, seasonal diet for overall well-being in winter.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The article discusses the Indian government's reluctance to engage with protesting farmers who have been calling for a legal guarantee for minimum support prices and other reforms. The Union Agriculture Minister has indicated the government is waiting for Supreme Court directives before initiating talks.

  • The protests are led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha.
  • Farmers have been protesting at the Punjab-Haryana borders since February last year.
  • The current government is taking a more hands-off approach compared to previous administrations.
“Abhi to Supreme Court dekh raha hai. Supreme Court ke jo nirdesh honge unaka paalan kiya jaega.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

The article highlights a shift in the Modi government's strategy towards farmer protests, emphasizing caution and reliance on judicial outcomes rather than direct negotiations.

item.title: Flights cancelled, icy roads, power outages: Severe winter storm grips US - The Times of India
item.description:
Flights cancelled, icy roads, power outages: Severe winter storm grips US

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: Major News Website

This severe winter storm has led to widespread flight cancellations, hazardous road conditions, and significant power outages throughout the United States, affecting thousands of residents.

  • Thousands of flights have been cancelled due to heavy snowfall and icy conditions.
  • Roads have become treacherous, prompting travel advisories in multiple states.
  • Power outages have impacted millions, with emergency services responding to downed lines.
  • Authorities advise residents to stay indoors and avoid unnecessary travel.
“This storm is particularly dangerous, and we urge everyone to heed local advisories.”

This winter storm is causing significant disruptions and challenges across the U.S., marking one of the harshest weather events this season.

item.title: I saw Samsung’s new OLED TV with Glare Free 2.0 tech, and it fixes the Samsung S95D’s biggest problem - TechRadar
item.description:
Samsung's New OLED TV with Glare Free 2.0 Tech Addresses Screen Reflection Issues

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: TechRadar

The Samsung S95F, which will feature the new Glare Free 2.0 technology, aims to tackle one of the key problems facing OLED TVs: screen reflections from ambient light sources. The latest tech promises improved black levels and shadow detail.

  • Samsung 2025 TVs feature new-gen 'Glare Free' tech.
  • Glare Free 2.0 better retains black depth and shadow detail.
  • Will feature in flagship OLED, and 8K and 4K mini-LED TVs.
“Enhancing black expression” along with rejecting glare is the primary focus of Glare Free 2.0 technology.

This new technology positions Samsung competitively against both established and emerging brands in the OLED market.

item.title: Samsung Electronics Unveils Samsung Vision AI and New Innovations at First Look 2025, Delivering Personalised, AI-Powered Screens to enrich Everyday Life - samsung.com
item.description:
Samsung Electronics Unveils Samsung Vision AI and New Innovations at First Look 2025

Date: January 2025 Source: Samsung News

Samsung Electronics unveils its latest innovations, including the Samsung Vision AI, which aims to provide personalized and intelligent screen experiences across various devices.

  • Samsung Vision AI enhances user interaction with smart, adaptive screens.
  • The flagship QN990F Neo QLED 8K TV features advanced AI-driven picture and sound quality.
  • New functionalities like Click to Search and Live Translate aim to deliver seamless viewing experiences.
  • The Samsung Art Store expansion introduces over 3,000 curated artworks for enhanced entertainment.
  • Collaboration with Microsoft's Copilot for personalized content recommendations on Smart TVs.
“Samsung sees TVs not as one-directional devices for passive consumption but as interactive, intelligent partners that adapt to your needs.” - SW Yong, President of Visual Display Business

This showcases Samsung's commitment to innovation and enhancing daily life through technology.

item.title: Canada's Justin Trudeau likely to resign as Liberal Party leader as early as Monday: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Trudeau Expected to Resign as Liberal Party Leader Soon

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is likely to resign as the leader of the Liberal Party as early as Monday, following increasing pressure after the resignation of his finance minister, Chrystia Freeland.

  • Trudeau's resignation is anticipated amid falling poll numbers for the Liberal Party.
  • The upcoming caucus meeting aims to address calls for his resignation.
  • Freeland's resignation on December 16 has amplified scrutiny on Trudeau.
  • Concerns are growing over economic instability and potential threats from the US administration.
“The country could face instability, notably from an economic threat in the potential of a 25% US tariff on Canadian imports from the incoming administration.” - Kody Blois, Liberal Party Leader

This impending leadership change could significantly affect Canadian politics, including potential ramifications for Trudeau's role as prime minister.

item.title: Canada's Trudeau likely to resign as Liberal Party leader this week: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Trudeau Expected to Resign as Liberal Party Leader Soon

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is likely to resign as the leader of the Liberal Party as early as Monday, following increasing pressure after the resignation of his finance minister, Chrystia Freeland.

  • Trudeau's resignation is anticipated amid falling poll numbers for the Liberal Party.
  • The upcoming caucus meeting aims to address calls for his resignation.
  • Freeland's resignation on December 16 has amplified scrutiny on Trudeau.
  • Concerns are growing over economic instability and potential US tariffs affecting Canada.
“The country could face instability, notably from an economic threat in the potential of a 25% US tariff on Canadian imports from the incoming administration,” - Kody Blois

Trudeau's decision is critical for the stability of the Liberal Party and the potential ramifications for Canadian governance as the country approaches an election year.

item.title: Samsung's AI Robot Ball With a Projector Is Real and Ready to Roll in 2025 - CNET
item.description:
Samsung's AI Robot Ball With a Projector Is Real and Ready to Roll in 2025

Publication Date: 2024 - Source: CNET

Samsung has officially announced that its rolling robot, Ballie, equipped with a projector, will be shipped in 2025. The robot can stream information and content and interact with smart home devices using voice commands.

  • Ballie was first showcased at CES 2020 as a home robot concept.
  • The robot can project content onto surfaces and has built-in speakers.
  • It recognizes voice commands and foot presses for interaction.
  • During demonstrations, it provided information about Las Vegas attractions and performed tasks like projecting the Uncharted movie.
  • Samsung faces competition from other companies like Amazon and LG in the home robot market.
“Make the screen bigger,” saw Ballie turn to find a new wall for projection.

This development signifies Samsung's commitment to innovative home technology, positioning Ballie among emerging home robots that enhance smart living.

item.title: BSE, NSE to hold special session for ITC-ITC Hotels demerger: What we know - Business Standard
item.description:
BSE and NSE Prepare for ITC-ITC Hotels Demerger on January 6, 2025

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Business Standard

Monday, January 6, 2025, is the record date for ITC shareholders to determine eligibility for shares of ITC Hotels following its demerger that took effect on January 1, 2025.

  • The ITC stock undergoes a pre-open session for price discovery.
  • Eligible shareholders will receive ITC Hotels shares based on their existing holdings.
  • The ITC stock will remain part of the indices for three trading days.
  • ITC retains a 40% stake in the new entity, distributing the remaining 60% to shareholders.
  • ITC Hotels shares are expected to list by mid-February 2025.
  • Early expiration for all ITC Futures and Options contracts related to the demerger.
“This move allows ITC Hotels to focus on growth in the luxury hospitality sector while maximising shareholder returns.”

This demerger represents a strategic shift for ITC, aiming to enhance shareholder value and business focus.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 6: Bajaj Finance, ITC, HDFC Bank, Marico, Dabur, Vedanta, HUL, L&T Finance, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch, January 6

Date: January 6, 2024

Source: Market Insights

The domestic equity market is anticipated to open positively on January 6, with significant updates from various major companies across sectors.

  • Dabur: Anticipates low single-digit growth due to inflation; strategic price increases planned.
  • HUL: Close to acquiring Minimalist; potential deal valued at ₹3,000 crore.
  • Marico: Reports a sequential uptick in domestic volume growth but modest operating profit growth due to input cost inflation.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank: COO Milind Nagnur resigns effective February 15, 2025.
  • ICICI Bank: Faces over ₹153 crore in tax penalties from Maharashtra GST Department.
  • HDFC Bank: Loan growth marginally up by 3% to ₹25.42 lakh crore.
  • ITC: Shares in focus due to hotel business demerger on record date.
  • Bajaj Finance: Reports a 28% YoY rise in assets under management (AUM) to ₹3.98 lakh crore.
  • Adani Wilmar: Reports 6% growth in sales volumes and 33% revenue increase in December quarter.
  • Vedanta: Aluminium production rose 3% YoY; zinc production reached record levels.
“If the deal goes through, Minimalist would have seen its valuation increase from around Rs 630 crore to ₹3,000 crore in a span of about three years.”

This ongoing activity in the domestic stock market showcases the mixed economic prospects and company performances as investors position themselves ahead of critical economic announcements.

item.title: Biggest dinosaur footprint site discovered from 166 million years - Dunya News
item.description:
Biggest Dinosaur Footprint Site Discovered from 166 Million Years

Published On: Mon, 06 Jan 2025 07:21:09 PKT

Scientists from Oxford and Birmingham have uncovered a significant find of dinosaur footprints dating back 166 million years, providing insights into the lives of long-extinct giants.

  • Discovery includes five extensive dinosaur trackways.
  • The longest trackway measures 150m and belongs to long-necked herbivores, likely Cetiosaurus.
  • A Megalosaurus track has also been identified among the finds.
  • The footprints were found at Dewars Farm Quarry in Oxfordshire.
  • Full-scale excavation involved over 100 scientists and volunteers.
  • More than 20,000 photographs were taken to create a 3D model of the site.
  • This find builds on previous discoveries from 1997 in the same area.
“These uniquely well-preserved tracks reveal stunning insights into the lives of the long-extinct giants.”

This discovery is crucial in understanding the prehistoric ecosystem and may reveal more tracks in future excavations.

item.title: Manipur tribal bloc ends NH2 blockade, with an ‘ultimatum’ - The Times of India
item.description:
Manipur Tribal Bloc Ends NH2 Blockade with Ultimatum

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The tribal bloc in Manipur has concluded its blockade of NH2, issuing an ultimatum in the process. This development is significant amidst ongoing tensions in the region.

  • The tribal bloc lifted the blockade on the National Highway 2.
  • An ultimatum was issued, pointing towards unresolved issues.
  • The situation reflects the ongoing political and social tensions in Manipur.
“This decision is crucial for the peace and stability of the region.”

This development underlines the need for dialogue and resolution of issues surrounding the tribal community in Manipur.

item.title: Canada PM Justin Trudeau to announce resignation this week: Report - The Hindu
item.description:
Justin Trudeau Expected to Resign as Liberal Party Leader

Published: January 06, 2025, Source: The Globe and Mail

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is expected to announce his resignation as Liberal Party Leader as early as January 6, 2025, according to reports from The Globe and Mail.

  • Sources indicate the announcement may come before a national caucus meeting scheduled for January 8, 2025.
  • It is unclear if Trudeau will resign immediately or serve as Prime Minister until a new leader is chosen.
  • Trudeau became Liberal leader in 2013, successfully revitalizing the party after a significant decline.
“Mr. Trudeau took over as Liberal leader in 2013 when the party was in deep trouble and had been reduced to third place in the House of Commons for the first time.”

The potential resignation represents a significant moment in Canadian politics as Trudeau has been a prominent figure in shaping recent governmental policies.

item.title: After HMPV outbreak in China, Maharashtra intensifies surveillance for respiratory disease cases - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Maharashtra Boosts Surveillance Following HMPV Outbreak in China

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Following the outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in China, the health department in Maharashtra has heightened surveillance for respiratory infections. The director of health services has instructed officials to report severe acute respiratory infections (SARI) and influenza-like illnesses (ILI).

  • No reported cases of HMPV in Maharashtra yet.
  • The HMPV is a common respiratory virus that primarily affects the upper respiratory tract.
  • Officials assure the public there is no need for alarm.
  • The situation in China corresponds to the seasonal flu pattern.
  • The government is in close watch and has requested updates from WHO regarding the situation in China.
“There is no need for the citizens to panic and the officials are asked to submit reports of SARI and ILI cases,” Dr Nitin Ambadekar stated.

In conclusion, while there is an outbreak in China, Maharashtra is maintaining a proactive approach to ensure public safety, with no immediate threat present locally.

item.title: Cold wave grips Delhi, light rain expected today; Kashmir sees fresh snowfall - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold Wave and Light Rain Expected in Delhi Amid Fresh Snowfall in Kashmir

Publication Date: Jan 06, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Inclement weather continues to grip Delhi with light rain expected, while Kashmir experiences fresh snowfall. The Indian Meteorological Department has warned of a cold wave affecting the national capital.

  • Cold wave conditions reported in Delhi, with a recorded temperature of 11.4 degrees Celsius.
  • IMD predicts a cloudy sky with light rain for Delhi on Monday.
  • Homeless individuals are utilizing night shelters to escape the harsh weather.
  • Air quality in Delhi classified as 'very poor', with an AQI of 316.
  • Fresh snowfall reported in several regions of Kashmir, maintaining subzero temperatures.
"Several trains were running late at New Delhi Railway Station due to dense fog in various parts of Uttar Pradesh and Punjab."

The severe weather continues to impact daily life in the region, prompting residents to seek warmth and shelter.

item.title: Yograj Singh At It Again, Sends Loud Message To Gautam Gambhir Over Virat Kohli's Form - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Yograj Singh At It Again, Sends Loud Message To Gautam Gambhir Over Virat Kohli's Form

Date: November 11, 2024

Source: NDTV

After India's disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, former cricketer Yograj Singh offered insights on Virat Kohli's lack of form, emphasizing the need for proper management instead of traditional coaching.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in five Tests, dismissed eight times for playing the wrong shots.
  • Singh argues that players need mental support and man-management rather than just technical coaching.
  • He highlights the importance of communication and understanding a player's struggles.
  • Singh critiques Gautam Gambhir's coaching style, advocating for better management alongside technical guidance.
  • The context of India's six-wicket loss in the Sydney Test, missing out on the World Test Championship final, emphasizes the urgency of these issues.
“When players are down, struggling to perform, management becomes that magic wand that lifts them up.” - Yograj Singh

In conclusion, Yograj Singh calls for a shift in how players, particularly stars like Kohli and Rohit, are supported during their challenging phases, stressing the intersection of performance and mental well-being.

item.title: Delhi authorities issue guidelines to prevent HMPV virus breakout amid rising respiratory illness cases in - DNA India
item.description:
Delhi Authorities Issue Guidelines to Prevent HMPV Virus Outbreak Amid Rising Respiratory Illness Cases

Date: Sunday, January 6, 2025 | Source: DNA India

Delhi health authorities have issued an advisory to prepare for potential health challenges related to the Human MetaPneumoVirus (HMPV) and other respiratory viruses amid reports of increased respiratory illnesses in China.

  • Mandatory strict isolation protocols and universal precautions for suspected HMPV cases.
  • Hospitals must report Influenza-like Illness (ILI) and Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI) cases through the IHIP Portal.
  • Healthcare facilities are instructed to maintain documentation of SARI and lab-confirmed influenza cases for accurate monitoring.
  • Availability of treatment options including paracetamol, antihistamines, bronchodilators, and cough syrups is essential.
  • No significant surge in respiratory illnesses was confirmed by the WHO as of January 2.
“Strict isolation protocols and the use of universal precautions for suspected cases have been made mandatory.”

These measures aim to ensure public health safety and timely response to potential outbreaks of respiratory illnesses.
